query: Will there be live-streamed sessions for those who can't attend in person?
output: Yes, the 2023 ACM Web Conference will include live streaming of ceremonies and keynotes for those who cannot attend in person.

query: Can non-students apply for the Virtual Participation Award?
output: No, non-students cannot apply for the Virtual Participation Award. The eligibility criteria specifies that an applicant must be a student connected to a university or research laboratory.

query: Where can I browse papers related to this conference after the conference?
output: You can browse the papers related to the ACM Web Conference 2023 on the SIGWEB website. Every paper will be fully accessible without charge by clicking on the links of the paper on that page. The website is https://www.sigweb.org/conferences/acm-sigweb-conferences/the-web-conference.

query: Will the conference proceedings be published, and if so, how can one access them?
output: Yes, the conference proceedings will be published. They will be made available through the ACM Web Conference 2023 page on the SIGWEB website and can be accessed without charge. Additionally, all accepted papers will be published by ACM and will be accessible through the ACM Digital Library.

query: How can I contact the conference organizers if I have further questions or concerns?
output: You can contact the conference organizers by emailing the appropriate chair for your specific concern. For example, for general questions, you can email chairs2023@thewebconf.org. Alternatively, you can email other chairs depending on your issues such as sponsorship2023@thewebconf.org for sponsorship, phd2023@thewebconf.org for PhD symposium, etc.

query: Is there any post-conference access to keynotes or talks
output: Every paper from The ACM Web Conference 2023 is fully accessible without charge by clicking on the links on the SIGWEB website. The live stream of the conference can be accessed on the official conference website, and a YouTube link is provided for a specific schedule. However, it is not directly specified whether all keynotes or talks will be available post-conference.

query: What is the main theme of the Web Sci2023 conference?
output: The main theme of the Web Sci2023 conference is "Inequalities in the Face of Concurrent Crises". The conference encourages contributions documenting differential uses of online spaces due to various factors such as race, ethnicity, and gender, especially in the wake of the pandemic and international tensions. The conference also emphasizes understanding inequities across digital spaces including digital news, social media, and peer production.

query: Is there any page limit of the manuscript
output: Yes, there are different page limits for different types of submissions. For research tracks submissions, the page limit is a maximum of 12 pages. For the PhD Symposium, the page limit is 5 pages. For the special tracks related to 'Web4Good', submissions are limited to 8 content pages with 2 additional pages allowed for supplementary material. Short papers have a limit of up to 4 pages plus references and discussion papers have a limit of up to 2 pages plus references. The total count for special track submissions with supplementary material and references should not exceed 12 pages.

query: What is the process of reviewing the submitted papers?
output: The process of reviewing the submitted papers starts with each paper being submitted to one of the listed tracks. Program Committee (PC) members then self-declare their expertise for each paper. Each submitted paper will receive at least three independent reviews within each track. The paper will then be discussed between PC members, the assigned Senior Program Committee (SPC) member, and track chairs, both before and after a rebuttal. The SPC member will provide a summary or "meta review" and oversee each submission and its review. Finally, the papers are ranked based on factors including technical merit, originality, potential impact, quality of execution, presentation, related work, reproducibility of results, and ethics.

query: What are the significant updates for the 2023 ACM Web Conference?
output: The significant updates for the 2023 ACM Web Conference include that due to logistical situations, as of April 26, they are not able to accommodate any more remote presentations. All speakers, presenters, and organizers are expected to attend the conference in person and, for exceptional reasons, if someone is unable to attend in person to present, they may assign a proxy who must be in person. Also, each accepted paper will appear in the proceedings and have an in-person presentation at the conference, and each accepted paper must have at least one non-student In-Person Main Conference (3 days) registration. Even if a student author is the only registrant for an accepted paper, they still must register for a non-student In-Person Main Conference (3 days).
